Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a go-ahead three-run homer in the 10th inning, securing the Yankees' 5-2 victory over the Guardians.
Giancarlo Stanton launched a game-tying, two-run homer in the sixth inning, earning him ALCS MVP honors.
Post-Match Reflections: Juan Soto expressed confidence and determination, stating 'We’re going to win; we’re going to the World Series.'
Aaron Judge praised the acquisition of Juan Soto, highlighting his impact on the team's success.
Manager Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's journey and special camaraderie.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. and Gerrit Cole commented on Soto's impressive at-bat and bat control.
Luke Weaver described his anticipation and relief as Soto's homer secured the win.
Giancarlo Stanton emphasized the importance of re-signing Soto for the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees celebrated their 41st pennant and will face the winner of the Dodgers/Mets NLCS in the World Series.
Juan Soto's acquisition from the Padres was a significant move that paid off for the Yankees.
Soto's performance in the ALCS has been pivotal for the Yankees' success.
